operator.name: Tours Northwest
operator.operatorType: Guided sightseeing tour operator specializing in Seattle city tours and Pacific Northwest day trips

products.title: Mt Rainier Tour from Seattle
products.shortDescription: Full-day guided tour from Seattle to Mt. Rainier National Park featuring old-growth forests, wildflower meadows, and waterfalls with 4 convenient pickup locations.
products.description: Visit Mt. Rainier from Seattle with our professional, enthusiastic, and informative guides. Travel in our clean, comfortable 24-passenger mini-coaches with large windows, high-back seats, and air-conditioning. The time of year will determine the route and accessibility of tours. In peak months, experience old-growth forests, wildflower-filled meadows, and thundering waterfalls on this tour of glacier-clad Mt. Rainier. Hike and walk a little, or not at all: there are options for all abilities. Enjoy lunch at a Mt. Rainier cafe (when open) or buy a picnic lunch along the way when we stop at a grocery store. Visit the interpretive center at Paradise or Sunrise to learn even more about the mountain's glaciers, plants, and animals on this exciting day trip to Mt. Rainier from Seattle. Return to Seattle through pastoral farmlands and memorable Pacific Northwest scenery. Summer tours feature wildflower meadows, higher elevation trails, and access to Paradise area. Winter tours offer a serene snow-covered wonderland with complimentary snowshoe rentals and lower elevation routes.

ageRestrictions.notes: Children under 5 are not permitted on this tour.

seasonality.notes: Year-round. Summer and winter routes differ based on seasonal road closures and weather. Limited availability during winter months.

products.cancellationPolicy: Full refunds on all tours canceled at least 24 hours in advance of the tour's start time. No refunds in the 24 hours leading up to the tour.

features.value: Comfortable 24-passenger mini-coach with large windows, high-back seats, and A/C
Cooler with ice packs for storing food
No minimum required number of guests – all scheduled tours run
No need for a park permit or timed entry
Now offering winter Mt. Rainier tours from Seattle
Options for all abilities – hike and walk a little, or not at all

Bring a camera, comfortable walking shoes (ideally hiking boots with good traction and water resistance). Layer both warm and cool weather clothing as mountain temperatures can vary. Sunscreen highly encouraged.
No bathrooms on the bus; guides provide restroom opportunities every 60-90 minutes.
Tours will NOT be impacted by the closure of the Carbon River/Fairfax bridge as it is not along the tour route.
Food stop at a grocery store on the way to the park for purchasing picnic lunch.

locations.name: Urban Coffeehouse (Midtown)
locations.notes: 15 minutes before tour start time. In front of Urban Yoga Spa.

locations.name: MoPop Pickup
locations.notes: 5 minutes before tour start time. Best option for parking downtown Seattle.

locations.name: SeaTac Matt Griffin YMCA
locations.notes: New! Best option for parking in SeaTac.

locations.name: Mt. Rainier National Park
locations.notes: Possible stops include: Henry M. Jackson Memorial Visitor Center, Paradise Inn, Skyline Trail, Reflection Lakes, Christine Falls, Myrtle Falls, Narada Falls, Silver Falls, Twin Firs Trail, Longmire Museum, Trail of Shadows, Panorama Point, Ricksecker Point, Stevens Canyon, Box Canyon, Tipsoo Lake, Nisqually River, White River, Sunrise Point, Sunrise Visitor Center. Itinerary varies based on season, weather, group preferences, and traffic.

media.alt: a lake in front of a mountain on the Mt Rainier Tour from Seattle
Tours Northwest Mt. Rainier Tour - What Can You See in a Day?

faqs.question: Places You Might See On Your Tour of Mt. Rainier
faqs.answer: While the itinerary varies widely based on seasonal road closures, weather, group preferences/abilities and traffic, possible stops include: Henry M. Jackson Memorial Visitor Center, Paradise Inn, Skyline Trail, Reflection Lakes, Christine Falls, Myrtle Falls, Narada Falls, Silver Falls, Twin Firs Trail, Longmire Museum, Trail of Shadows, Panorama Point, Ricksecker Point, Stevens Canyon, Box Canyon, Tipsoo Lake, Nisqually River, White River, Sunrise Point, Sunrise Visitor Center. No single-day tour will visit all of these.

faqs.question: What hotels do you pick up at?
faqs.answer: No direct hotel pickups for this tour, but there are 3 convenient downtown pickup locations within a short walk of most hotels: Seattle Public Library (1000 4th Ave), Urban Coffeehouse/Midtown (1900 4th Ave), and MoPop (325 5th Ave N). Plan to arrive 5 minutes before scheduled pickup time. Look for a white mini-coach that says Tours Northwest.

faqs.question: Where can I park my vehicle in downtown Seattle?
faqs.answer: Recommended: MoPOP pickup location with 2 garages across the street. Other options: Pacific Place Garage (600 Pine St) two blocks from Midtown pickup with lower hourly rates. On weekends and after 4pm weekdays, free parking at Amazon Doppler Building Garage (2021 7th Ave, 7am-2am), about 5 minutes walk from Midtown pickup.

faqs.question: Are there bathrooms on the bus?
faqs.answer: No bathrooms on the mini-coaches, but guides provide opportunities for public restrooms every 60-90 minutes during tours.

faqs.question: What should I wear to Mount Rainier National Park?
faqs.answer: Dress for comfort and the weather. Comfortable shoes (ideally hiking boots with good traction and water resistance) will make a huge difference in enjoyment.

faqs.question: What is the best time of year to visit Mt. Rainier?
faqs.answer: July and August are the most popular months as snow has melted, wildflowers are in bloom, and it is warmest. It is incredible year-round, but be prepared for inclement weather and snow.

faqs.question: What will the weather be like?
faqs.answer: Weather on the mountain is very unpredictable, even from one hour to the next. Prepare for cooler temperatures at higher elevations and the possibility of rain or snow. During July and August it may also be hot and sunny with considerable snow on the ground. Bring sunscreen.

faqs.question: Do I need to bring food?
faqs.answer: Food options in the park are extremely limited. A grocery store stop is made on the way. You can purchase lunch there and store it in the provided cooler with ice packs. You may also bring your own food and use the cooler from the beginning of the tour.

faqs.question: What should I do if I'm running late to my pickup?
faqs.answer: The bus cannot wait more than a minute or two past pickup time. Contact the office at 206-768-1234 as soon as you know you'll be late. No refunds if you are not at your designated pickup location at the pickup time.

faqs.question: What is your cancellation policy?
faqs.answer: Full refunds on all tours canceled at least 24 hours in advance of the tour's start time. No refunds in the 24 hours leading up to the tour. For private tours, minimum 48 hours notice for a full refund.
